Case reference: 2014006315.CaseDesc: Julia STROBACH was last seen in her residence on Braidwood Road in Courtenay, British Columbia on October 31st, 2013 in the early evening hours.  Unfortunately, after a lengthy and comprehensive investigation police have been unable to find any trace of Julia.  Police along with Julia’s friends and family are gravely concerned for Julia's wellbeing as she has been out of contact for a year now.  It is completely out of character for Julia to be out of contact with her friends and family for so long, especially with her 3 year old son.  Police are appealing to anyone with information about Julia's movements and activities in the days and weeks leading up to October 31st, 2013, to get in touch with investigators immediately.

Hair: Brown, Dyed, Long, Often dyed red

Case reference: 2014006556.CaseDesc: On the 23rd of July, 2006, Preston WALDNER was swimming at Paradise Beach, South Saskatchewan River, when he and another fellow were attempting to swim across the river. The boys got part way across when they ran into trouble due to the very strong current of the river. The one fellow was pulled from the river and survived, however Mr. WALDNER was seen going under and he never resurfaced. A search was conducted but Mr. WALDNER has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Howling wolf with the initial "PWW" above the wolf

Case reference: 2019068219.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2019, Marshal Iwaasa was last seen by his family in Lethbridge, Alberta. During this time, Marshal had told his family that he was returning to Calgary, Alberta. On November 23, his burnt vehicle was recovered at the end of Phelix Creek Forest Service Road, in a remote area near the Birkenhead Lake Provincial Park in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001337.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1983, Micheline Chailler was seen for the last time at her apartment in Lévis, Quebec. Micheline last contacted a member of her family by telephone on March 19, 1983. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, Beige, Brown with beige stripes

Case reference: 2013000145.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Ralph Simington. He was last seen in Calgary, Alberta on June 15, 2012.

Case reference: 2016024223.CaseDesc: Joseph Amiro was last seen leaving the Queen Elizabeth II Health Sciences Centre in Halifax, Nova Scotia on May 1, 2016.  Mr. Amiro suffers from medical issues that require daily medication. He is known to wear glasses and walk with a cane. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018067156.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2018, Courtney James was seen for the last time on security camera footage in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001419.CaseDesc: On December 4th, 1993 Elizabeth Mitchell was seen for the last time at her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Her abandoned vehicle was found later that morning near Tablerock, Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Elizabeth was despondent.

Scar: Shoulders, Surgical scar on left shoulder

Case reference: 2014004950.CaseDesc: On June 5, 2007, Kim Rogelstad was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Kim's family has not seen or heard from her since May 27, 2007.

Case reference: 2012020068.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1996 Winston Redhead's father reported that he had not heard from his son since December 21, 1995.  Winston's brother advised that Winston indicated he would be home for Christmas.  The last contact with Winston was made by staff at the Main Street Project in Winnipeg on December 26, 1995.  He told staff there that he would be going back up north. Winston has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2010000599.CaseDesc: Bradley Allan Taylor was on his way home to Enfield, Nova Scotia from London, Ontario. He spent the night in Brockville, Ontario at the Travelodge Motel.  On January 10, 2009, he left the motel in the morning and later that day police found his car abandoned near a railway crossing in Roussillon, Quebec. Many of his personal belongings were found in the car. Police searched the area but Mr. Taylor was not located.

Hair: Brown, Long, Straight, Beard, Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2014002223.CaseDesc: Edward Joesph Arcand left his residence in Coleman, Alberta on June 8, 1975, driving a 1969 Ford Falcon station wagon.  On June 15, 1975 his vehicle was found abandoned 80 km north of Coleman on highway 940.  Mr. Arcand has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018069671.CaseDesc: Jacob Jackson was last seen in 2018 in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Jacob leads a transient lifestyle and has lived in Winnipeg, Manitoba; Regina, Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Montreal, Quebec, British Columbia and Prince Edward Island. Jacob may use different names.

Case reference: 2012020098.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1975, at approximately 3:00 a.m., Irene Scherban was seen for the last time in front of her residence in Hudson Bay, Saskatchewan. Prior to her disappearance, Irene had attended a party.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, HBCH High school insignia ring
Mark: Chest, Round birthmark located near ribcage area
Nose, Thin red mark below the bridge of nose

Case reference: 2006027999.CaseDesc: On August 15, 1986 Clayton Duncan McFaul was last seen by a family member on the family farm near Havelock Ontario. Mr. McFaul was completing his usual daily farm chores. He was very punctual about meal times, so when he failed to arrive for his lunch his family were concerned. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. McFaul.  Several possible sightings were reported after August 15, 1986, but none led to Mr. McFaul's location.

Hair: Bald, White, Other, Bald with fringe

Case reference: 2020011912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2017, Jeffrey Caporale was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Shortly before his disappearance, Jeffrey had been treated at the University of Alberta hospital.

Case reference: 2015066565.CaseDesc: George Wood was last seen in Surrey BC, on June 20, 2015 by family. At the time George Wood was reported missing, he was unemployed and of no fixed address living on the streets in Burnaby BC. His absence and not keeping in touch with family is out of character.

Belt: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black belt with large silver buckle
Scar: Right Arm, Long scar on right arm

Case reference: 2013000087.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1993, Alan Curtis was seen for the last time during a visit to his uncle’s home in Montreal, Quebec. He was to take a flight from Mirabel airport to go home to British Columbia. He never arrived at his destination.

Luggage: Blue, Metal box and a tent

Case reference: 2006020899.CaseDesc: Pooran Shivcharan, age 36, was last seen in an aircraft heading west bound in the direction of Geraldton, Ontario on November 13, 1981. Although he was originally headed toward Thunder Bay, he may have altered his course towards Geraldton or Raith.  Search efforts were unable to locate Mr. Shivcharan or his aircraft.

Case reference: 2020006482.CaseDesc: On January 11, 1990, Emabit Yafru travelled from Ethiopia to Toronto, Ontario. On January 25, 1990, her husband came to Toronto and could not locate her. During the time of her disappearance, Emabit was five months pregnant.

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020062.CaseDesc: On July 15, 2000 Marcus McKay went hunting with his step father and three others.  Marcus and his step father broke apart from the group to hunt on their own. Some time later, the pair successfully felled a deer. Marcus was to stay with the deer while his step father went to get help from their friends. When his stepfather returned Marcus was no where to be found. He was last seen 10 km north of Mallard and Bison Road.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2018046052.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1997, Eric Wong was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Eric was in Canada continuing his education and had contacted his mother in October 1997 for help with his tuition fees.

Case reference: 2012020075.CaseDesc: On June 22, 1974, Annie Yassie was seen for the last time by a taxi driver in Churchill, Manitoba. At that time, Annie was accompanied by a male friend.

Case reference: 2017073521.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2017, an unidentified woman was recovered from Lake Ontario near Humber Bay Shores Park, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts she was of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2019032078.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2019, at aprroximately 2:19 pm, Shauranne Humphry was seen for the last time at the Anduhyaun Shelter in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004643.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2002, Carol Tuks was last seen while exiting a Greyhound bus in Red Deer, Alberta.

Pierce: Ears, single piercing in each ear

Case reference: 2014002407.CaseDesc: Robert Scott Ellis and a friend headed out fishing on June 27, 1973. They left in the morning around 9:30 am and fished until around 6:00 pm when they decided to return home. During the course of the day, poor weather rolled in and the water became quite rough. They started taking in water over the sides of the canoe. Despite the progress they made, one wave eventually rolled the canoe. Both men hung onto the canoe for hours, but Robert eventually tired and let go.  When the friend eventually reached shore, he reported the incident. Dragging and diving operations were initiated and the results were negative. Mr. Ellis is presumed to have drowned. No foul play is suspected in this case.

Case reference: 2021015231.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 1:06 p.m., James Ryding was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, James may have been despondent.

Coat: Blue, Winter, Possibly wearing a puffy royal blue coat

Case reference: 2012020101.CaseDesc: William Gill was last seen in the early morning hours of December 21, 1981, leaving an apartment on Appleby Drive in Saskatoon, SK. Mr. Gill had been out earlier that evening at a local nightclub with his co-worker.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003568.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1998, Todd Russell Fraser was seen for the last time in the Fairview district in Vancouver, British Columbia. All his belongings were found in his apartment. Todd has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2005003899.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2001, a Caucasian male was found on a bench in an outhouse on a cross country ski trail in the Laurentian Hills, Deep River. He was well-tanned and had recently got a sunburn on his face. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. He is estimated to have been dead for two to three days. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Glasses: Copper, Koh Sakai, frame model KS9365, reflective lens
Jeans: Blue, Pepe, size 30, button fly front
Jewelry: Blue, Levi's, Blue faced, built in compass watch
Shoes: Black, Replay, size small running shoes

Case reference: 2014003365.CaseDesc: At approximately 2:00 p.m. on October 30, 1982, Daniel Christensen left the family cabin in the area of Long Lake, Manitoba. He left with the family dog and his intention was to go chicken hunting. His family reported him missing the next day.  On November 6, 1982, the family dog returned to the cabin in good health. Mr. Christensen has never been located.

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2014003848.CaseDesc: On November 5, 1964, the Grand Rapids RCMP was advised that there were rumors that Harvey Hudson was two weeks over due in returning from a trip to Cedar Lake from Grand Rapids. After numerous inquiries it was discovered M. Hudson left The Pas Manitoba on October 20th and arrived at Cedar Lake Post.  When he reached Cedar Lake, M. Hudson was advised by a friend to wait for a boat from Easterville which was expected shortly. A witness who spoke to M. Hudson indicated that he first left on foot for Easterville but turned back. He then took a canoe and started off for Easterville using a piece of board as a paddle. It is believed that Mr. Hudson had little or no food, no rifle or other camping gear. Numerous land, air and water patrols were made with negative results.

Case reference: 2014001852.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1995, Ms. Runningbird was seen for the last time, she was out near Swan Lake, walked away from her friends and never returned.

Case reference: 2015050387.CaseDesc: Linda Normandin was last seen leaving a shelter in Longueuil on September 3, 2015. She has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005436.CaseDesc: On May 5, 2009, Mohamed Ibrahim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004672.CaseDesc: On the 13th of June, 1995, Marcel Legris and a friend were last seen fishing on Cold Lake, SK. A large storm suddenly came up and it is believed swamped the boat they were using. The friend’s body was located, however, Mr. Legris was never found.

Case reference: 2014001301.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1999, Harold Donald Maskell was reported missing by his cousin Mike Viger. Harold’s cousin had come to visit him at his residence in Coles Island, New Brunswick, but there was no sign of him at the house. A search of the shoreline of the Canaan River returned negative results. Harold does not drive and cannot walk very far.

Shirt: Red, Plaid, Plaid; red, white, blue

Case reference: 2014005152.CaseDesc: Anker Ljunggren was a farm hand who worked in Yellow Grass, SK. Ljunggren was last seen in October, 1935, by his wife. He was working in Craik or Craven, SK but was heading north to find more work and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2019066843.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2019, Feng Qin Zhou, was reported missing from her residence on Firbridge Way in Richmond, British Columbia. She suffers from dementia and has previously wandered away from her residence. Feng Qin does not speak any English and speaks only in Mandarin.

Coat: Black, Long coat down to the knees with hood
Shirt: Pink, Long sleeve shirt with white writing
Shoes: Pink, Slippers with heel support and hard soles
Watch: Red, Two watches, one on each wrist

Case reference: 2018000324.CaseDesc: On October 6, 2006, Freda Whiteman was seen for the last time at the York Hotel in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005219.CaseDesc: Lori Lee Berens was last seen January 15, 1985 in the Winnipeg area. Lori has not made contact with her family since then and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Often wore a ponytail

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2016041364.CaseDesc: Tony Olekas was last seen on July 21, 2016 when he was mushroom picking at Big Sandy Lake, Sasketchewan.

Case reference: 2013000018.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 2010, Varaporn Toassami left Canada with her daughter, Chonticha Galamae Ellefson-Toassami in contravention of a family Court Order.  They travelled to Thailand, where it is believed they still are today.  Varaporn Toassami has been charged with child abduction under Section 282 of the Criminal Code.  There is a warrant for her arrest.

Case reference: 2016050062.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2016, Jami Springer was last seen in Moncton, New Brunswick.  Since then, no one has heard or seen Jami, and the police consider her disappearance as suspicious.

Case reference: 2006022599.CaseDesc: Edwin Scherer was last seen while on a hunting trip at Cedar Point Lodge on Gordon Lake. He was on vacation at the time and was a resident of Wisconsin, U.S.A.

Jewelry: Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, watch with 3 black stones
Gold, Blue, Ring, large blue stone
Shirt: Wool, White, Black, lumberjack style; dirty
Vest: Brown, Orange, hunting vest with orange on the shoulders

Case reference: 2014005149.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2008, Zelalem Assefa was last seen visiting relatives in Calgary, Alberta. Zelalem is from Ethiopia and had only been in Canada for about a year and a half when he disappeared.

Case reference: 2013000052.CaseDesc: Denis Lapensée was last seen on May 28, 1998, in Montreal and was reported missing on June 2, 1998. Mr. Lapensée suffers from schizophrenia and was very depressed following a breakup with his spouse. He has previously mentioned that he intends to throw himself off the Jacques Cartier Bridge. M. Lapensée has bad dentition, is right-handed and smokes a pipe.

Hat: White, toque, blue and red polka dot

Case reference: 2021048330.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2015, at approximately 7 :00 a.m., Dan Ingram was seen for the last time as he slipped and fell into the water near the Whirlpool State Park in Niagara Falls, New York.

Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2023008967.CaseDesc: Frank Herbert Molzahn was last seen on CCTV leaving his condo building on December 29, 2022 at 7:26pm. The condo building is located at 1201 Northshore Blvd. East, Burlington, Ontario, Canada.

Case reference: 2014004805.CaseDesc: Patrick Ratto was reported missing from his Burnaby residence July 27, 2006. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. Ratto since his disappearance. Mr. Ratto previously resided in Quebec and may have moved back. The Burnaby RCMP would like to speak with anyone who has any information on Mr. Ratto's whereabouts.

Hair: Brown, Short, Small brown & grey goatee
Jacket: Black, White, Windbreaker with white markings and a logo

Case reference: 2006018799.CaseDesc: Michael Recollet was last seen on August 20, 1991 at Okeechobee Lodge Dock, in Fraser Point. He was  heading in a westerly direction towards Birch Island by boat. His 16 foot cedar strip boat and 25HP Mariner motor were recovered near Mary's Point, Little La Cloche Island.

Case reference: 2013000097.CaseDesc: On January 25th, 1981, police received a call regarding the drowning of Deanne Bousquet. Three children were playing on the ice on the river when two of the children broke through. Deanne was unable to pull herself out and was last seen going under the water. Ice in the area was very thin due to warm water being dumped by the mill. All efforts made to locate Deanne were negative.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Ms. Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, money, her credit card, and her cell phone, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2021036756.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2021, Curtis Thorne was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Saint John, New Brunswick. Curtis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles
Left Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles

Case reference: 2014005030.CaseDesc: Wilfrid Langlois has been missing since February 5, 1998. At the time of his disappearance, it is possible that he was in the Chandler area of the Gaspé Peninsula.

Case reference: 2014001312.CaseDesc: John McAllister was last seen leaving his home on May 7, 1973. Mr. McAllister's truck was found near Lodgepole, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020053.CaseDesc: Jennifer Catcheway has been missing since Thursday June 19, 2008. Ms. Catcheway was seen at approximately 12:00 pm leaving Grand Rapids en route to Portage la Prairie, Manitoba.  During her travels it is believed that she was dropped off near the Waterhen junction - Provincial Road 328 and PTH #6. Ms. Catcheway has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001381.CaseDesc: On March 24, 1982, Patricia Elizabeth Flynn was last seen running away from her family residence in a densely wooded area near her home in Yarrow, British-Colombia. Patricia was despondent and had medical issues that required attention at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish. They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2010004099.CaseDesc: Timmy Villemaire was last seen by his family in the Cambridge area sometime in 2001. At the time of his disappearance, he was showing signs that he may have been suffering from schizophrenia. He was queried by a Waterloo Regional police officer in Cambridge on June 1, 2002. Normal checks on his health card, SIN card and more cards have shown no activity since the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Curly, Beard, moustache, sideburns

Case reference: 2008008099.CaseDesc: Ronald Wallin was canoeing in Upper Manitou Lake located south of Dryden.  Mr. Wallin suffered from what appeared to be a seizure and fell into the water disappering beneath the boat. The area was searched, but Mr. Wallin was not found.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2006011399.CaseDesc: Raymond Juranitch went hunting and fishing on the Ogoki Reservoir 80 km northeast of Armstrong, Ontario. He was last seen alone in a 16' aluminum canoe, powered by a 9.8 HP outboard motor. An extensive search of the area failed to locate Mr. Juranitch.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2008005899.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1965, George Angeconeb left Red Lake on foot with plans to walk to Trout Lake.  He left during a severe snowstorm carrying a record player.  He was last seen at MacDowell Lake, First Nation Territory, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006028099.CaseDesc: Diane Marie Bourne was last seen on March 6, 1976, at her residence in Ashton, Ontario. Extensive police investigation has failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014005313.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2007, Azelea Brown last spoke to her mother who was overseas.

Case reference: 2014003916.CaseDesc: Pierrette Bouffard was last seen on January 9, 1997, in Saint-Romuald, Quebec, as she was heading to her room in the home she was living in.

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2016068328.CaseDesc: This male foot was found washed up on the shore of Gull Island in Presqu'ile Provincial Park. The foot was inside a black "PUMA" ankle sock and a size 11 women's "Mizuno Wave Prophecy" running shoe. The shoe was first available for sale in Spring 2011. The post-mortem interval is anywhere from one month to 2 and a half years.

Case reference: 2014000018.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2001, Dawn Rees was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Dawn was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2016012267.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2016, Lorlene Bone was last seen at a friend’s residence on the Shoal River Indian Reserve in Manitoba. Lorlene is a mother of four and it is out of character for her not to contact her family.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Three hearts

Case reference: 2016061229.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1973, a male individual was found on the GO Train tracks near Roncesvalles and the Gardiner, beneath the Sunnyside Walkway, from which he apparently fell/jumped. His post-mortem length was 5’5"-5’8", but due to extensive bone fractures this may not accurately reflect his height. His appendix was not present.

Hair: Short, Straight, Dark, straight hair approximately 2-3" in length
Shirt: Grey, Patterned, may have been blue and white

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2017060465.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2017, Jesse Clint Galganov was seen for the last time when he took a flight to Peru from the Montréal-Pierre-Elliott Trudeau Airport in Montreal, Quebec. On September 28, 2017, Jesse contacted his mother to tell her that he was going to go hiking for a few days in the forest. Since this time, Jesse has not been seen nor has he contacted his family to provide them with his whereabouts which is contrary to his habits.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles

Case reference: 2014005508.CaseDesc: In October 2010, Maxime Jacques left Winnipeg, Manitoba by bus to visit family in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On October 30, 2010, Mr. Jacques never arrived at his destination and his family reported him as missing.

Case reference: 2014005316.CaseDesc: On March 31, 2002, Jenifer Morse was seen for the last time when she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002239.CaseDesc: On the August 24, 1993, Cynthia-Ann Peddle, commonly known as Cindy Paddle, was seen for the last time in Sept-Îles, Quebec. There is a possibility that Cindy frequented the area of Vieux Quai in Sept-Îles before her disappearance.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Faded Jeans, thigh pockets
Vest: Red, Pink, T-Shirt, Pink or red

Case reference: 2014003765.CaseDesc: On the morning of August 11, 1994, Neil Hicks was seen for the last time leaving his temporary residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance Neil suffered from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014002108.CaseDesc: Craig Waldum along with 7 others were on a canoeing expedition along the Nelson River. Craig was one of two guides on the expedition. On August 18, 1978, three members of the expedition were on shore guiding in a canoe. The remaining 5 members including Craig remained in the canoe. As these individuals labored to guide the canoe to shore, the rope was given some slack. This caused the bow of the canoe to turn out into the current, which in turn caused the canoe to tip. The individuals on shore were unable to hold onto the rope due to the strength of the current and the canoe was carried downstream. Craig hung onto the canoe for a couple hours then was seen letting go. He slipped under the water and did not resurface. Mr. Waldum's remains have not been recovered and foul play is not suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2008005698.CaseDesc: On February 16th, 1994, Calvin Simms was last seen in the area of Church street in St.Catharines, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance Calvin was despondent.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2014004316.CaseDesc: Trevor Angell was last heard from on September 22, 2000. Mr. Angell is a truck driver who was taking a load from Calgary, Alberta to Los Angeles, California.  His truck was located on September 25, 2000 in Primm, Nevada, USA.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014002572.CaseDesc: André Demange was last seen on September 2, 1983, in Montreal, Quebec. André's personal effects were found a few days later near the water close to Des Ormeaux and Bellerive street.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020083.CaseDesc: On June 4, 1980, John Roy MacLellan, 79 years old, was last seen in Lintlaw, SK. Mr. MacLellan's medical condition made him, at times, confused. In October of 1980, his vehicle was located in the Usherville district. Searches of that area have failed to locate Mr. MacLellan.

Case reference: 2012020038.CaseDesc: Desiree Oldwoman was last seen near her home on the Siksika Fist Nations Reserve near Gleichen, Alberta. She is autistic and does not speak, although she can write her name. Ms. Oldwoman was last seen on August 27, 2011.

Case reference: 2011002599.CaseDesc: On May 29, 1998, Marcus Schmidseder walked away from his family’s home in Mississauga. Marcus’s intended destination is unknown; there was a possible sighting of him in Massey, Ontario on June 9, 1998. He may have been attempting to make his way to the western provinces.

Case reference: 2014002983.CaseDesc: On the 14th of June, 1986, Joseph MAJOR, 75 years old, was reported missing from a care home in the Hudson Bay district, SK. Extensive ground searches of the area failed to locate Mr. MAJOR.

Case reference: 2021045206.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2021, Mark Dolan was last seen by his family when he was dropped off at a bus terminal in Brantford, Ontario. His last banking transaction was captured on video at 294 Louisa Street in Parry Sound, Ontario, on October 28, 2021.

Luggage: Other, Multi coloured hiking style backpack.
